title: Honoring Tupper Thomas upon the occasion of her retirement after 30 years of distinguished service to the Prospect Park Alliance
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring Tupper Thomas upon the occasion of her
retirement after 30 years of distinguished service to the Prospect  Park
Alliance

WHEREAS,  This  Legislative  Body seeks to acknowledge those individuals
whose professional lives and civic endeavors serve to enhance the  stat-
ure of the State of New York; and
  WHEREAS,  For  the  past  30  years,  Tupper Thomas rendered faithful,
conscientious and valuable service to Prospect Park Alliance; and
  WHEREAS, After 30 years as Park Administrator  and  23  as  President,
Tupper  Thomas  will  step down in early 2011; in her dual roles, she is
credited with restoring Brooklyn's Prospect Park; and
  WHEREAS, Prospect Park was built in the 1860s by Central Park  design-
ers  Frederick  Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux; but by the 1950s, the park
was on a steady decline, suffering from poor maintenance and high crime;
in 1979, the year before Tupper Thomas started, park attendance fell and
was near an all-time low; and
  WHEREAS, Originally from  Minneapolis,  Minnesota,  Tupper  Thomas  is
responsible  for  saving  the  original vision Frederick Law Olmsted and
Calvert Vaux had for the park; her strong and positive attitude produced
results where others saw little hope; she is a true  asset  to  society;
and
  WHEREAS,  Tupper  Thomas co-founded the non-profit Prospect Park Alli-
ance to help restore the park; its  first  project  was  renovating  the
park's carousel which had been closed for years; and
  WHEREAS,  Under Tupper Thomas' leadership, educational programming was
implemented, community involvement was enhanced and  there  has  been  a
tremendous  increase  in  the  number  of individuals and businesses who
support the park; the number of annual visits to the park has  increased
from one and a half million to nine million; and
  WHEREAS,  In  her  capacity  as  President,  Tupper Thomas served with
loyalty, honor and distinction; and
  WHEREAS, In her official acts, Tupper Thomas was governed  by  a  keen
sense of duty and always showed a unique grasp of human problems; and
  WHEREAS,  During her tenure with Prospect Park Alliance, Tupper Thomas
earned the admiration, esteem and  affection  of  her  colleagues;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Tupper Thomas upon the occasion of her retirement after  30  years
of distinguished service; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Tupper Thomas.
